title: Political Advertising Transparency Data Standard
description: A schema for how political advertising data is presented to increase comprehension, trust, interoperability, and quality of analysis.

advertiser_id.description: An internal ID for the advertiser (e.g. a pageID)

advertiser_real_name.description: The name of the entity running the advert (e.g. "The Democratic Party")

advertiser_internal_name.description: An internal name of the entity (e.g. a short url "democrats")

advertiser_website.description: The website of the entity (e.g. "https://democrats.org" - useful to de-duplicate/unify data)

advertiser_electoral_id.description: An (external) ID held by an electoral regulator (e.g. FEC ID)

advertiser_legal_status.description: The legal status of the entity (e.g. individual, company, charity, political party)

advertiser_type.description: The type of entity (e.g. candidate, elected official, political party, non-profit, public figure etc)

advertiser_verification_date.description: The date the entity was verified (blank if not, or no verification programme)

advertiser_geo_scope.description: Allow the entity to specify where they are active (country, region within country etc)

advert_id.description: An internal ID for the advert

ad_library_entity_url.description: A deeplink to the entity in the platform advert library

ad_library_advert_url.description: A deeplink to the advert in the platform advert library

advert_copy.description: All text used in the advert

advert_alt_text.description: All alt text used in images. Can be automatically generated by the advert publisher

advert_transcript.description: An automated or user-provided transcript/subtitles for audio or video adverts

advert_media_urls.description: Link(s) to the media files used in the advert

advert_urls.description: The external URLs used in the advert (e.g. where the advert clicks through to)

advert_automation.description: What, if any, features of the advert were automated/automatically generated?

advert_automation_test_result.description: How did this advert perform relative to others it was tested against?

advert_deleted.description: TRUE if the advertiser later deleted the advert after it ran

group_not_disclosed.description: Default value. Unclear if part of a group of adverts

group_id.description: A shared ID for all adverts in the same advert group

testing_not_disclosed.description: Default value. The advert doesn't make use of the platform's testing capabilities

testing_test_set.description: A value to associate each tested variation with others in the same set

datetime_ended.description: When the advert stopped running (blank if still delivering impressions and budget not exhausted)

datetime_approved.description: The date and time the advert was approved to run

platform_name.description: The name of the advertising platform

platform_url.description: The URL of the advertising platform

platform_ad_policy.description: The public URL of the platform's advertising policies and rules

iab_id.description: IAB ID for advertising technology providers. For more details read the IAB's website "TCF – Transparency & Consent Framework"

geo_location_not_disclosed.description: Default value. Unclear whether geolocation data was used

geo_location_approximate.description: Geolocation data is based on either fuzzified lat-long or IP-derived location

geo_location_precise.description: Precise geolocation data, as defined by the IAB TCF v2.0

geo_location_unknown_type.description: Other geolocation types, including cases where both APPROXIMATE and PRECISE are used or where APPROXIMATE or PRECISE cannot be determined

remarketing_not_disclosed.description: Default value. Unclear whether remarketing is used

remarketing_third_party.description: The advert targeting is based on online or offline data about you from someone who may or may not be the advertiser. Value is the name of this entity

remarketing_dataset_name.description: A name given to the dataset by the entity above. For example 'Potential customers'

remarketing_website_visit.description: The advert targeting is based on a previous visit to an advertiser’s website

remarketing_unknown_type.description: Other remarketing types not listed or undetermined. For example, UPLOADED or WEBSITE_VISIT cannot be determined

user_characteristics_not_disclosed.description: Default value. User characteristics weren’t used

user_characteristics_gender.description: The advert targeting criteria is (partially) based on either declared or inferred gender

user_characteristics_age_group.description: The advert targeting criteria is (partially) based on either declared or inferred age group

user_characteristics_languages.description: The advert targeting criteria is (partially) based on either declared or inferred user language(s)

user_characteristics_exclusions.description: Any exclusions based on user characteristics

user_interests_not_disclosed.description: Default value. Unclear whether user interests are used

user_interests_excluded.description: User interests that were excluded from targeting

user_interests_used.description: The advert targeting criteria is (partially) based on either declared or inferred user interests

context_not_disclosed.description: Default value. Unclear whether context is used

context_used.description: The advert targeting criteria is (partially) based on either declared or inferred context. Value is the context(s), such as the website(s) or networks being targeted. For instance, in the case of YouTube, `context` can be the search term that triggered the advert being shown to the user.

other_not_disclosed.description: Default value. Unclear whether other information is used

other_used.description: The ad targeting criteria is (partially) based on other information, either declared or inferred

audience_size_lower_bound.description: Lower bound of the estimated target audience size

audience_size_upper_bound.description: Upper bound of the estimated target audience size

spending_total.description: The exact amount spent on the advert

spending_budget.description: The total budget for the ad at time of creation

spending_lower_bound.description: The lower bound of spending on the ad (e.g. $500)

spending_upper_bound.description: The higher bound of spending on the ad (e.g. $600)

delivery_optimization.description: The delivery optimization method selected by the advertiser

impressions_paid_lower_bound.description: Lower bound of the number of paid advert impressions delivered

impressions_paid_upper_bound.description: Upper bound of the number of paid advert impressions delivered

impressions_organic_lower_bound.description: Lower bound of the number of non-paid (e.g. via shares) advert impressions delivered

impressions_organic_upper_bound.description: Upper bound of the number of non-paid (e.g. via shares) advert impressions delivered

unique_users_lower_bound.description: Lower bound of the number of unique users who saw > 1 impression of the advert

unique_users_upper_bound.description: Upper bound of the number of unique users who saw > 1 impression of the advert

engagement_clicks.description: The number of clicks on the advert

engagement_social.description: The social engagement with the advert, presented as an array (likes/shares/comments if these features are available)

demographics_gender.description: The reach of the advert, broken down by gender

demographics_age.description: The reach of the advert, broken down by age ranges (25-34, 35-44 etc)

demographics_location.description: The reach of the advert, broken down by country and geographical area

moderation_review_type.description: Automated, manual or none. Refers to the highest level of moderation an advert received (e.g. if an automated system referred it for manual review, the value is "manual"). Presented as an array: Datestamp of moderation => Moderation type

moderation_3rd_party_fact_check.description: Presented as an array: Datestamp of check => Link to information about check

moderation_rule_applied.description: Approved ads = NULL, otherwise link to or description of specific ruile that led to the advert not being approved

provider_data.description: This property should hold any other data that are not platform-specific but are still necessary to make sense of the data described above. This is an extensible property.
